Post_Title: Call Transfer & Escalation Protocols: When AI Transfers to Humans

Post_Title: SMS Follow-Up Automation Playbook: Post-Call Sequences Timing & Templates
Angle: Post-call SMS automation: immediate confirmation ("Thanks for calling, your appointment is confirmed for [DATE]"), 1-hour follow-up (missed call → "We missed your call, here's my calendar link to book: [URL]"), next-day engagement ("Hi [NAME], following up on your service request. Any questions?"), review request sequence (3 days after service: "How did we do? Leave a review: [LINK]"), re-engagement for non-responders (7 days: "Still interested in [SERVICE]? Reply YES to schedule"). Timing strategy, message templates by industry, TCPA compliance (opt-in requirements, opt-out handling), A/B testing SMS copy, click-through rate optimization.

Post_Title: Payment Collection During Calls: Deposit Automation & Stripe Integration
Angle: Collect payments over phone: deposit collection for appointments (hold appointment slot with $50 deposit), credit card on file (store card for future billing without processing now), instant booking confirmation with payment ("I'll charge your card $X and send confirmation email"), Stripe integration setup (PCI compliance, secure card tokenization), refund automation (no-show penalty, cancellation policy), payment plan setup over phone ("$500 total, pay $100 today and $100/month for 4 months"). Industries: contractors (project deposits), salons (appointment deposits), consultants (session fees), event planners (venue deposits). Compliance, security, failed payment handling.

Post_Title: Voicemail Follow-Up Automation: Callback Scheduling & Engagement Sequences
Angle: When voicemail is left: automated transcription → email to owner with transcript + caller info, instant callback scheduling ("We received your voicemail, schedule a callback here: [LINK]"), SMS follow-up ("Hi [NAME], we got your message about [TOPIC]. Can we call you back at [TIME]?"), lead scoring in CRM (voicemail = lower urgency than live answered call), multi-touch follow-up sequence (voicemail → SMS 5 min later → Email 1 hour later → Phone callback next business day), abandoned voicemail handling (caller hung up mid-message). Voicemail greeting optimization, response time SLAs, follow-up templates.

Post_Title: Seasonal Surge Management Protocols: Black Friday Tax Season & HVAC Rush
Angle: Prepare for predictable surges: Black Friday e-commerce (10x normal call volume, "We're experiencing high call volume, order online at [URL] for instant confirmation"), tax season accounting (January-April surge, extended hours, overflow to partner firm), summer AC rush HVAC (June-August, pre-book maintenance appointments in May, surge pricing communication), holiday retail (November-December, gift card sales, return policy questions), storm/disaster response contractors (roofing after hail, tree service after hurricane, 500% call spike in 48 hours). Pre-surge preparation checklist, staffing strategy (AI handles surge, humans do complex calls), post-surge analysis.

Post_Title: Call Analytics & Reporting Playbook: KPIs Dashboards & Optimization Strategies
Angle: Which metrics to track: answer rate (% of calls answered vs missed), average handle time (how long each call takes), transfer rate (% calls transferred to human), booking rate (% calls that result in appointment), lead capture rate (% calls that provide contact info), call volume by time of day (staffing optimization), call source tracking (which marketing channel drove call), sentiment analysis (positive vs negative calls), revenue per call (appointment value, close rate). Weekly review checklist, dashboard setup in Google Data Studio, A/B testing greeting scripts, optimization strategies (reduce transfer rate by improving AI training, improve booking rate with better availability communication).

Post_Title: After-Hours Emergency Triage: Emergency vs Non-Emergency Routing Logic
Angle: After-hours call routing logic: true emergency (no heat in winter, burst pipe, legal arrest, medical urgent care) → instant transfer to on-call staff, moderate urgency (AC not working in summer but not heatwave, legal consultation needed soon) → collect info + schedule early next-morning callback, low urgency (routine appointment request, general inquiry) → schedule next business day callback. Escalation triggers, on-call rotation (who's on call tonight?), emergency contact tree (try technician → try manager → try owner), emergency vs non-emergency examples by industry (HVAC: no heat in winter with kids/elderly = emergency, routine maintenance = non-urgent), caller expectation management ("This is not an emergency, we'll call you back tomorrow at 9am").
